explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test method applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 88-89degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data), test temperature: 140degC).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine or chlorine

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 88-89degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 1,405mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1969)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of >5.17mg/L (4 hours), together with the absence of mortality (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1991)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (exposure duration unknown) (PATTY (4th, 1999)): "Slight irritation." The substance is thus considered a mild irritant.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the descriptions in the reports on rabbit eye irritation tests: "Mild irritation" (PATTY (4th, 1999)) and "Mild" (RTECS (2006)).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Not classified
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: Based on the description in the reports on skin sensitization tests in animals (species unknown) (PATTY (4th, 1999)): "Non-sensitizer." Also based on the description in the report on guinea pig maximization tests (IUCLID (2000)): "not sensitization."

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro reverse mutation tests, in vitro chromosome aberration tests and in vivo host mediated reverse mutation tests in mice (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1979, 1989, 1998)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in carcinogenicity studies in rats and mice (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1988, 1992)).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction or offspring development observed in rat 2-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1988, 1992)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "ataxia," "salivation," "reduced locomotor activity," "sedation," "abnormal gait," and "lacrimation" (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1969, 1986)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours EbC50=0.0062mg/L of the algae (Skeletonema) (ECETOC TR91, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (BCF=11(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data, )), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.
